title: Neville Brody and a new typeface for The Times newspaper:
author: miles

comments.content:
[http://typophile.com/node/29521](http://web.archive.org/web/20100825003617/http:/typophile.com/node/29521 "http://typophile.com/node/29521")

At least they're not claiming that the Times is the only newspaper to use bespoke typefaces.

Tim

[http://www.timesonline.co.uk/article/0,,6-2457539,00.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20100825003617/http:/www.timesonline.co.uk/article/0,,6-2457539,00.html "http://www.timesonline.co.uk/article/0,,6-2457539,00.html")

The font is only used for headlines and not copy which continues to be set in Times Classic (Farey/Dawson) which I find quite hard to read.

Someone draw them a decent lion on their masthead please.

Sorry - there's already a thread about this:  
 [http://typophile.com/node/29521](http://web.archive.org/web/20100825003617/http:/typophile.com/node/29521 "http://typophile.com/node/29521")
